name: European Network for Accreditation of Engineering Education
membership:
IFEES (International Federation of Engineering Education Societies);
EASPA (European Alliance for Subject-Specific and Professional Accreditation and Quality Assurance); CIQG (Council for Higher Education Accreditation International Quality Group)
goal:
Verify that engineering educational programmes accredited by participating national Agencies satisfy a common set of standards (EUR-ACE Framework Standards for Accreditation of Enginering Programmes);
provide a common European Quality label (EUR-ACE label) to programmes accredited by participating Agencies;
thus enhance quality and professional relevance of engineering education.

As of November 2017, 15 Agencies have been authorized to award EUR-ACE labels: ASIIN, DE; CTI, FR; MUDEK, TR; EngC, UK; EngineersIreland; Order of Engineers, PT; AEER, RU; QUACING, IT; ARACIS, RO; KAUT, PL; ANECA, Spain; FINEEC, Finland; AAQ, Switzerland; ZSVTS, Slovakia and KazSEE, Kazakhstan. More than 2600 EUR-ACE labels have been awarded at either "Bachelor" or "Master" level.
interests: Culture, Education, Employment and Social Affairs, External Relations, Research and Technology, Trans-European Networks
euInitiatives: Education and training related initiatives, FTAs (MRAs)
